name: responseBody.Receipt.In_app
desc: An array that contains the in-app purchase receipt fields for all in-app purchase transactions.

items.name: cancellation_date
items.desc: The time the App Store refunded a transaction or revoked it from family sharing, in a date-time format similar to the ISO 8601. This field is present only for refunded or revoked transactions.

items.name: cancellation_date_ms
items.desc: The time the App Store refunded a transaction or revoked it from family sharing, in UNIX epoch time format, in milliseconds. This field is present only for refunded or revoked transactions. Use this time format for processing dates.  See cancellation_date_ms for more information.

items.name: cancellation_date_pst
items.desc: The time the App Store refunded a transaction or revoked it from family sharing, in the Pacific Time zone. This field is present only for refunded or revoked transactions.

items.name: cancellation_reason
items.desc: The reason for a refunded or revoked transaction. A value of “1” indicates that the customer canceled their transaction due to an actual or perceived issue within your app. A value of “0” indicates that the transaction was canceled for another reason; for example, if the customer made the purchase accidentally.

items.name: expires_date
items.desc: The time a subscription expires or when it will renew, in a date-time format similar to the ISO 8601.

items.name: expires_date_ms
items.desc: The time a subscription expires or when it will renew, in UNIX epoch time format, in milliseconds. Use this time format for processing dates. See expires_date_ms for more information.

items.name: expires_date_pst
items.desc: The time a subscription expires or when it will renew, in the Pacific Time zone.

items.name: is_in_intro_offer_period
items.desc: An indicator of whether an auto-renewable subscription is in the introductory price period. See is_in_intro_offer_period for more information.

items.name: is_trial_period
items.desc: An indication of whether a subscription is in the free trial period. See is_trial_period for more information.

items.name: original_purchase_date
items.desc: The time of the original in-app purchase, in a date-time format similar to ISO 8601.

items.name: original_purchase_date_ms
items.desc: The time of the original in-app purchase, in UNIX epoch time format, in milliseconds. For an auto-renewable subscription, this value indicates the date of the subscription's initial purchase. The original purchase date applies to all product types and remains the same in all transactions for the same product ID. This value corresponds to the original transaction’s transactionDate property in StoreKit. Use this time format for processing dates.

items.name: original_purchase_date_pst
items.desc: The time of the original in-app purchase, in the Pacific Time zone.

items.name: original_transaction_id
items.desc: The transaction identifier of the original purchase. See original_transaction_id for more information.

items.name: product_id
items.desc: The unique identifier of the product purchased. You provide this value when creating the product in App Store Connect, and it corresponds to the productIdentifier property of the SKPayment object stored in the transaction's payment property.

items.name: promotional_offer_id
items.desc: The identifier of the subscription offer redeemed by the user. See promotional_offer_id for more information.

items.name: purchase_date
items.desc: The time the App Store charged the user's account for a purchased or restored product, or the time the App Store charged the user’s account for a subscription purchase or renewal after a lapse, in a date-time format similar to ISO 8601.

items.name: purchase_date_ms
items.desc: For consumable, non-consumable, and non-renewing subscription products, the time the App Store charged the user's account for a purchased or restored product, in the UNIX epoch time format, in milliseconds. For auto-renewable subscriptions, the time the App Store charged the user’s account for a subscription purchase or renewal after a lapse, in the UNIX epoch time format, in milliseconds. Use this time format for processing dates.

items.name: purchase_date_pst
items.desc: The time the App Store charged the user's account for a purchased or restored product, or the time the App Store charged the user’s account for a subscription purchase or renewal after a lapse, in the Pacific Time zone.

items.name: quantity
items.desc: The number of consumable products purchased. This value corresponds to the quantity property of the SKPayment object stored in the transaction's payment property. The value is usually “1” unless modified with a mutable payment. The maximum value is 10.

items.name: transaction_id
items.desc: A unique identifier for a transaction such as a purchase, restore, or renewal. See transaction_id for more information.

items.name: web_order_line_item_id
items.desc: A unique identifier for purchase events across devices, including subscription-renewal events. This value is the primary key for identifying subscription purchases.
